meanings.definition: To have made a promise or commitment beforehand.
meanings.sent1: She preassured her friend that she would be there for her no matter what.
meanings.sent2: He preassured his boss that he would finish the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The student preassured the teacher that he would study hard for the test.
meanings.sent4: The athlete preassured his coach that he would give his best performance.
meanings.sent5: The parent preassured the child that they would always love and support them.

meanings.definition: To have applied pressure or force before an action or event.
meanings.sent1: The chef preassured the dough before baking it to make it rise properly.
meanings.sent2: She preassured the bottle before opening it to prevent it from spilling.
meanings.sent3: The mechanic preassured the tire before fixing the puncture.
meanings.sent4: He preassured the brakes before going down the steep hill.
meanings.sent5: The doctor preassured the wound to stop the bleeding before stitching it up.
